pull_request.title: Fix type annotation of source parameter.
pull_request.body:
This might be completely wrong, but I think the type hinting of the `source` parameter for `Elasticsearch().search()` should be `Sequence[str]` and not `Mapping[str, Any]` (s. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html#source-filtering)
Also `fields` should be accepting `str` as well as `Mapping[str, Any]`

issue.title: Fix type annotation of source parameter.
issue.body:
This might be completely wrong, but I think the type hinting of the `source` parameter for `Elasticsearch().search()` should be `Sequence[str]` and not `Mapping[str, Any]` (s. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html#source-filtering)
Also `fields` should be accepting `str` as well as `Mapping[str, Any]`

issue.title: Documentaion on how to configure trace logging
issue.body:
<!-- Feature request -->

I am troubleshooting a query that is not working as expected in python, but I can run an equivalent query through my kibana ui.

The documentation for [logging](https://elasticsearch-py.readthedocs.io/en/v7.17.10/index.html?highlight=logging#logging) indicates that the `elasticsearch.trace` logger needs to be configured/activated to get the body of the web calls logged. I do not know how to configure this properly, and feel an example in the docs for how to configure this would be helpful for myself and others.


I am running code like what is below. I Set the log level to DEBUG for all, and then set propagate=True for the specific trace logger, but that does not seem to be what is needed to activate. I am still not seeing the body of the requests in the logs.
```
import logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, format='%(levelname)s || %(name)s.%(funcName)s:%(lineno)d || %(message)s')
logging.getLogger('elasticsearch.trace').propagate=True
```

and then running a query

```
es = Elasticsearch("http://localhost:9200")
es.search(index="myIndex", query=myQueryVar)
```

returns console logs like:

```console
DEBUG || urllib3.connectionpool._new_conn:228 || Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost:9200
DEBUG || urllib3.connectionpool._make_request:456 || http://localhost:9200 "POST /git/_search HTTP/1.1" 200 111572
INFO || elastic_transport.transport.perform_request:336 || POST http://localhost:9200/git/_search [status:200 duration:0.004s]
```

issue.title: Documentaion on how to configure trace logging
issue.body:
<!-- Feature request -->

I am troubleshooting a query that is not working as expected in python, but I can run an equivalent query through my kibana ui.

The documentation for [logging](https://elasticsearch-py.readthedocs.io/en/v7.17.10/index.html?highlight=logging#logging) indicates that the `elasticsearch.trace` logger needs to be configured/activated to get the body of the web calls logged. I do not know how to configure this properly, and feel an example in the docs for how to configure this would be helpful for myself and others.


I am running code like what is below. I Set the log level to DEBUG for all, and then set propagate=True for the specific trace logger, but that does not seem to be what is needed to activate. I am still not seeing the body of the requests in the logs.
```
import logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, format='%(levelname)s || %(name)s.%(funcName)s:%(lineno)d || %(message)s')
logging.getLogger('elasticsearch.trace').propagate=True
```

and then running a query

```
es = Elasticsearch("http://localhost:9200")
es.search(index="myIndex", query=myQueryVar)
```

returns console logs like:

```console
DEBUG || urllib3.connectionpool._new_conn:228 || Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost:9200
DEBUG || urllib3.connectionpool._make_request:456 || http://localhost:9200 "POST /git/_search HTTP/1.1" 200 111572
INFO || elastic_transport.transport.perform_request:336 || POST http://localhost:9200/git/_search [status:200 duration:0.004s]
```

comment.body:
Hello! And sorry for the late answer.

The documentation you're linking to is about elasticsearch-py 7.17, but you're using version 8.x because your code is using https://github.com/elastic/elastic-transport-python/ which is the library that issues requests and logs them for verson 8.x. 

As a result, the relevant documentation is now at https://elastic-transport-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html. You'll find the `debug_logging()` function very helpful.

issue.title: elasticsearch  "URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')" not accepting paths in the URL
issue.body:
<!-- Bug report -->


```
pip list | grep elastic
elastic-transport                                 8.4.1
elasticsearch                                     8.10.0
elasticsearch-dsl                                 8.9.0
elasticsearch-kibana-cli                          0.6.1
elasticsearch-query                               2.4.0
```

When adding a path in the url a Value Error is raised and connection fails to the remote elk host , url without a path initiates a connection , but in our setup we require the path to be included when initiating the connection,

Python Code used with elasticsearch version 8.10

```python3
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch
es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za/elastic/v1:443', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)
```

```python3
 % ./elk_test.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./elk_test.py", line 108, in <module>
    kibana_get_info(elasticip, vtoken, timenow, prevtime)
  File "./elk_test.py", line 31, in kibana_get_info
    es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za/elastic/v1:443', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/__init__.py", line 347, in __init__
    ssl_show_warn=ssl_show_warn,
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 105, in client_node_configs
    node_configs = hosts_to_node_configs(hosts)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 143, in hosts_to_node_configs
    return hosts_to_node_configs([hosts])
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 151, in hosts_to_node_configs
    node_configs.append(url_to_node_config(host))
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elastic_transport/client_utils.py", line 217, in url_to_node_config
    "URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')"
ValueError: URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')
```

```python3
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch
es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za/elastic/v1', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)
```

```python3
 % ./elk_test.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./elk_test.py", line 108, in <module>
    kibana_get_info(elasticip, vtoken, timenow, prevtime)
  File "./elk_test.py", line 31, in kibana_get_info
    es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za/elastic/v1', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/__init__.py", line 347, in __init__
    ssl_show_warn=ssl_show_warn,
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 105, in client_node_configs
    node_configs = hosts_to_node_configs(hosts)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 143, in hosts_to_node_configs
    return hosts_to_node_configs([hosts])
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 151, in hosts_to_node_configs
    node_configs.append(url_to_node_config(host))
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elastic_transport/client_utils.py", line 217, in url_to_node_config
    "URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')"
ValueError: URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')
```

```python3
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch
es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za:443', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)
```

Without a path in the url , connection gets initiated , can ignore the index error

```python3
 ./elk_test.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./elk_test.py", line 108, in <module>
    kibana_get_info(elasticip, vtoken, timenow, prevtime)
  File "./elk_test.py", line 64, in kibana_get_info
    result = es.search(index="voice.*", body=query_body, size=100)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/utils.py", line 414, in wrapped
    return api(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/__init__.py", line 3925, in search
    "POST", __path, params=__query, headers=__headers, body=__body
  File "/Users/username/PycharmProjects/GNS3-Python/venv1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/elasticsearch/_sync/client/_base.py", line 321, in perform_request
    message=message, meta=meta, body=resp_body
elasticsearch.NotFoundError: NotFoundError(404, "{'message': 'no Route matched with those values'}") 
```

comment.body: I didn't realize this used to work, thanks for the information.

comment.body: Hello, thanks for the feature request! This is something I would like to add in the future, but for now the client only works without a path.

ValueError: URL must include a 'scheme', 'host', and 'port' component (ie 'https://localhost:9200')


from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch
es = Elasticsearch('https://api.elkserver.co.za:443', headers={"v_token": v_token}, timeout=120)

Without a path in the url , connection gets initiated , can ignore the index error

issue.title: Fix type annotation of source parameter.
issue.body:
This might be completely wrong, but I think the type hinting of the `source` parameter for `Elasticsearch().search()` should be `Sequence[str]` and not `Mapping[str, Any]` (s. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html#source-filtering)
Also `fields` should be accepting `str` as well as `Mapping[str, Any]`

comment.body: Hello, and thank you! However this code is generated from https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch-specification/blob/main/specification/_global/search/SearchRequest.ts which is the place to fix if the type hint is wrong. I can check in more details at the end of next week.

pull_request.title: Fix type annotation of source parameter.
pull_request.body: This might be completely wrong, but I think the type hinting of the `source` parameter for `Elasticsearch().search()` should be `Sequence[str]` and not `Mapping[str, Any]` (s. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html#source-filtering)

repo.name: elasticsearch-py
repo.description: Official Elasticsearch client library for Python

issue.title: Please bring back `body` parameter to API calls
issue.body:
**Describe the feature**: Currently, when the documentation or implementation is out of sync (see #2179 , #2180 for examples) the API becomes unusable and users have to resort to using the underlying `perform_request` method eliminating some of the benefits of having a dedicated API (parameter checking, URL composition, type hinting, ...). It would be useful to still be able to pass in the entire `body` in those cases.

It would also be great for the common use case of getting an object from Elasticsearch, modifying it, and reapplying it to the cluster, for example index templates, ILM policies, and other configurations. This cannot be now easily done with `**body` since there are some manually introduced changes like `_meta` in the JSON body as opposed to `meta` in the python API. This makes the API extremely brittle for such cases.

comment.body:
elasticsearch-py 8.10.1 removed the deprecation warning! https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch-py/releases/tag/v8.10.1.

What is left to do is allowing any `body`, not just the ones we think are valid according to https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch-specification/ (which is not always fully up-to-date and does not account for custom plugins). The current workaround is to call `client.perform_request`.

release.body:
- Removed deprecation warnings when using `body` parameter (#2302)
- Fixed some type hints to use covariant Sequence instead of invariant List (#2324, #2325)
release.short_description_html:
• Removed deprecation warnings when using body parameter (#2302)
  • Fixed some type hints to use covariant Sequence instead of invariant List (#2324, #2325)
